Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of child. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Red slip. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Similar features present on a late 3rd to early 2nd century BC piece (Fischer 1994, pl. 43, no. 428). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.566) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, no. 302)
